boardgame.name: Rommel's Best!
boardgame.description:
This is a variant of 「Guderian's Best.ver3.0」

Solitaire tank simulation board game.
I aim at surviving while it being the fight car head of the tank corps under the Erwin Rommel conduct as for you during a period from 1941 through 1943, and fighting against the military unit of the British military.
"The command of the air" and "temperature" added the element of "the sandstorm" to the game system newly after having followed 「Guderian’s Best」 of Mr. Nigel Hodge.

boardgame.name: Fulda liebenswert-lebenswert ...spielend kennenlernen
boardgame.description:
The players roll the die and move their game piece along a given path through Fulda. They can collect victory points (5, 10, 15 or 20) at specially marked squares. To reach these fields, you may also move backwards.
The first player to reach the target field with at least 500 victory points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Gatekeeper
boardgame.description:
Gatekeeper is an intense 2-player cardgame that has you pitched against an opponent in a duel. In four locations you will position witches out of your hand and attempt to take control in small and larger scale confrontations, with the mysterious Gatekeeper playing a merciless referee using some unique dynamic mechanics.

When positioning a witch of a specific element at a location, columns are formed. A new witch will compare her spellpower with that of the opposing witch, with the higher value "dazzling" the weaker party. In dazzled state, witches are vulnerable for the vicious Gatekeeper that is now activated by the Gatekeeper value on the last played witch, moving X-number of locations in a set cycle movement. In the location she lands in, she will check if a dazzled witch is present and eliminate her from the contest.

Next, she will activate a rondel and move a marker to the next position, activating the next Element Gate in line.
By activating the gate she awakens all the witches of this element present at the location, triggering a larger scale confrontation, with the player holding majority inflicting damage equal to the number of withes they have present. The defending player can however fend off part of the attack with opposing witches.

Each witch also cast 1 of 10 unique special spells, each manipulating parts of the duel in devious ways. This additional layer creates tough decisions in an already challenging duel of wits.

Will you control the Astral plane by lowering the mana level of your opponent to "0"?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alpha Wave
boardgame.description:
A fast paced arcade space shooter influenced by all time classics like AstroSmash, Space Invaders and Galaxian. Quick, fun bursts of action perfectly tailored for a nice 10-15 minute break all for much less than a high society coffee!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Super Kontakt
boardgame.description:
The game aims to illustrate the performance characteristics of a 20th century Siemens "EMS" programmed telephone. The players are to move their 6 game pieces in turn to target fields by rolling the dice. Before the sixth playing piece may enter a target field, all so-called "contact chips" must be used up. In order to gain certain advantages in the course of the game, the players must collect cards with features of the telephone on predefined fields. These are, for example, the right to enter a target field, to hand over more contact chips, to enter occupied fields, etc.
The first player to hand in all contact chips and move their 6th piece to a target field wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: DUOS: Things & Animals
boardgame.description:
12 pictures, and 4 pairs to choose. Oh, this pair is obvious... or is it?
How will the other players think? Can you predict?

12 cards and 4 pairs to create. Make pairs like the first player to score points. 2 categories (Things & Animals) of cards and over 100 pictures in each. Simple rules and dynamic gameplay, plus lots of conversations over the table after each round. DUOS is a game that will work both with players and the family.

boardgame.name: Kung-Fu
boardgame.description:
Kung-Fu is played on a 10*9 field. Each player has 3 pieces, 1 great master (Shihan) and 2 fighters (Bujin), which he places on his baseline.

Players move their pieces alternately and have to allocate 2 movement points to their pieces. On squares that the pieces leave, they leave obstacle stones (Ate, 30 pieces). These can be jumped over if the square behind them is free. 3 special obstacle stones (Geri) prevent them from being jumped over.

There are 3 ways to win the battle, a) move your own Shihan to the opponent's baseline or b) capture the opponent's Shihan or c) capture the opponent's Bujin and immobilise the opponent's Shihan. Any other result is considered a stalemate.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Legends of Sleepy Hollow: The Ghost of Tarry Town
boardgame.description: This expansion includes two bonus standalone chapters for Legends of Sleepy Hollow, with new epic relic and skills upgrade cards and chits. Plus advanced difficulty game mats for all the chapters in the base game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow

boardgame.name: The Dwarves: Goimgar Character Pack
Die Zwerge Charakterpack: Goimgar
boardgame.description:
Additional hero for the game The Dwarves.

"Goïmgar Glitterbeard was quite lanky, only about half as wide as the two twins Boïndil Twoblade and Boëndal Pinnhand, and even much more petite than most of the others of his tribe, which was unusual for a dwarf. Goïmgar's curly beard hung full of diamond dust that had collected in his hair when he cut the gems. It looked as if he had trapped thousands of tiny stars in his beard."

In the The Dwarves Big Box is already enough space for the two new characters Djerun and Goimgar. You will then have 14 different miniatures to choose from.

boardgame.name: The Dwarves: Djerun Character Pack
Die Zwerge Charakterpack: Djerun
boardgame.description:
Additional hero for the game The Dwarves.

„Djerun is, like all acronta, able to let his eyes flash up in a violet light, which will terrify almost all kinds of creatures. He is wearing an armour made of tionium (tionium is a black metal). His helmet’s visor resembles a grotesque demon’s face. Djerun is carrying a club, an axe, a sword and a serrated shield.“

In the The Dwarves Big Box is already enough space for the two new characters Djerun and Goimgar. You will then have 14 different miniatures to choose from.

boardgame.name: Maracaibo: Der Aufstand
Maracaibo: El Alzamiento
Maracaibo: The Uprising
boardgame.description:
The first big expansion of Maracaibo features several modules and scenarios, e.g. pushing the predominant nations out of the Caribbean (in competitive or cooperative mode). Other elements are asymmetrical player abilities, a new optional stories and legacy tiles as well as new project cards. Solo fans will encounter a new rival ("Jacque").

—description from the publisher

Title: Maracaibo - Uprising (NL) Publisher: Geronimo Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Ship Dossier: Launches
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don't laugh... it's paid for.

Sometimes a launch is all you have or need to get to the next job or move that special cargo or passenger from orbit to ground or vice versa. A small ship, the launch can still provide big adventure hooks as its owner ply their trade: survey, search and rescue or just plain freighting. this provides deck plans for three versions of the launch as well as a set of extra large plans for gaming action, all in detail. this includes several new fittings: lift ports, suit locks, and passenger fittings.

Why kill yourself paying a fat mortgage when you can own a small craft outright?

boardgame.name: Post-Apocalyptic Barbarian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wasteland is a cruel place, coddling no weakness and rewarding only strength and tenacity. Out of its blasted terrain ride a people as harsh and deadly as the irradiated land that bore them. Survivors, scavengers, and throwbacks, they are all that remains when warfare and catastrophe burns away the façade of civilization. They are Post-Apocalyptic Barbarians. Born from the ashes of world-shattering conflicts, they are conflict incarnate. Driven by rage, they live by blade, bullet, and wit. Making use of whatever tools and technology they can cobble together from scraps of metal and rusted machinery, they lurk within the husks of crumbling factories and ride on tides of screaming steel.

This basic character class is stat'ed for the Pathfinder RPG but can easily be used in conjunction with any OGL/d20 system games.

boardgame.name: Staatsmann
boardgame.description:
The players have to start from point zero after a war in order to get their country's economy going again.

To do this, they can disband existing armies (but lose power) in order to improve education, nutrition, raw material supply and consumer goods industries. Negotiations with the opposing countries, non-aggression pacts and lots of events as well as a variety of dice results control the course of the game.

The balance of power represented by armies (heavy metal chips) and thus decision-making powers is measured on a weight scale.

Two of the participating countries are so-called crisis countries, which have even worse starting conditions. They can also be played as non-player countries.

The player who leads his country to prosperity in the most economic sectors wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Final Fusion
boardgame.description:
Mix two unique factions and lead them through a constant conflict in a tight space. Colonize, upgrade and dominate to be the first to perform Final Fusion.

Final Fusion is a 2-4 (5 with expansion) player competitive game where you become a villainous commander in charge of two unique factions. To win you must perform a Final Fusion - an action that leaves you vulnerable unless you gather Void Particles first. Wait too long, and see other players win the game.

Constant conflict from the first round
Unique victory condition, not another point salad
Elaborate alien miniatures, not another bags of spacecrafts
Beautiful locations instead of balls floating in space
28 Starting Faction Combinations (66 with expansion)


Short description of Gameplay
Final Fusion is a 2-5 players 60-90m conflict-driven space game, where each player leads an alliance of two alien races. Both races contribute a set of unique cards (used for actions and conflict resolution) and their Fleet (represented by a miniature with a functional tray to put your armies on).

From the first turn of the game, you partake in a “Fistfight in a space elevator” of a kind. All around you’ll have bloodthirsty neighbors waiting to strike. It is crucial to pick your battles and keep tabs on opponents - to know when to push back and when to tactically retreat.
The aim of the game is to achieve the eponymous Final Fusion, a feat of cosmic engineering on par with building a death star. This task requires getting Void Particles (VP for short), either by extracting them, colonizing locations, or dominating your opponents. While at it players strategically buy new technologies for their decks, gain Traits, and man their fleets to prepare for massive space battles.

Beware! The more VP you have, the easier it is to complete Final Fusion, but if you wait too long, another player might initiate the Fusion before you!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Socially Twisted: Party Game
boardgame.description:
Socially Twisted is the party game for bad people with good humor. Create a twisted story and get competitive with your friends or family. It’s a quick, funny, wacky, icebreaker, guaranteed to leave everyone cracking up!

Players are dealt story cards and word cards and must craft a storyline within 60 seconds. Then everyone votes for the most twisted story told.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tails of Fallout: Equestria
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Fallout: Equestria campaign setting for the Tails of Equestria tabletop roleplaying game. This unofficial, fanmade book provides over 200 pages of new content for running Fallout: Equestria themed games in the Tails of Equestria system, including new races, talents, quirks, equipment, vehicles, creatures, NPCs, as well as an advanced scuffling system for tactical combat, an abridged atlas of locations and factions, and supplemental rules for a more action-packed or grittier wasteland experience!

Friendships may change in the Equestrian Wasteland, but war... war never changes.
boardgame.rpg: My Little Pony: Tails of Equestria

boardgame.name: Die Insel der Katzen: Kätzchen + Biester
La Isla de los Gatos: Mininos y Bestias
The Isle of Cats: Kittens + Beasts
L'île des chats: Bêtes + Chatons
Ostrov koček: Koťata a jiná stvoření – 3. rozšíření
Острів котів: Кошенята і звірята
Остров Кошек: Чудища + Котята
boardgame.description:
The Isle of Cats: Kittens + Beasts is an expansion for The Isle of Cats adding 3 new expansion modules to the game. It also adds a new lesson module (I) to the game and 6 new family cards.

Each of the 3 expansion modules can be used independently with The Isle of Cats or combined in any way you wish.

Kitten module
Complexity: Easy
Compatible with: Standard mode, solo mode, family mode, and up to 6-players
The Kitten module adds more importance on being the fastest player each day and introduces new options in the form of kittens, without adding much complexity to the game.

Beast module
Complexity: Medium
Compatible with: Standard mode, solo mode, family mode, and up to 6-players
The Beast module adds ancient beasts to the game which provide early game goals while you search for lesson cards. Each beast will only be happy if it is near its friends and you will need to carefully position cat families around these creatures if they are to form friendships and score points.

Event module
Complexity: Hard
Compatible with: Standard mode, solo mode, and up to 6-players
The event module adds rule changing events to rounds 1 and 5, and ways to score points to rounds 2, 3, and 4. This provides another layer of challenge as you will need to adjust your strategies each round, and plan how to best use the rule changes to your advantage.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Die Insel der Katzen: Neue Boote
La Isla de los Gatos: Paquete de Barcos
The Isle of Cats: Boat Pack
L'Île des Chats: Pack de bateaux
Острів котів: Набір кораблів
Остров Кошек: набор кораблей
boardgame.description:
The Isle of Cats: Boat Pack is an expansion for The Isle of Cats adding new boat boards to the game.

The Boat Pack expansion introduces 6 new boats, all of which have unique shapes and new layouts. Whether you are playing the standard, family, or solo mode, these new boats will require you to re-evaluate your options, come up with new strategies, and find new ways to fit cats, kittens, and beasts onto your boat.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Prise De Fer
boardgame.description:
Prise De Fer is an 18-card sword fight duelling game for 2 players. It is quick to learn and can be played in under 30 minutes.

Players draw a hand of sword fighting moves from the common deck and take turns playing cards to attack and defend their body targets. If an attack goes unblocked the attacker scores a point, the deck is reshuffled, cards dealt back out, and the fight continues. The first player to score 5 points wins.

Some cards attack or defend a single location, while others can be used for a range of targets. Maintaining control over the pace of the fight can be just as important as having the right cards.

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
Kickstarter
Like new. Only played a couple times. All components well cared for. Non-smoker
Venmo preferred but will accept others

boardgame.name: Vigil - The Villains & Vigilantes Fanzine (Issue 1 - 1985)
boardgame.description:
Vigil

The Villains & Vigilantes Fanzine

1985

boardgame.name: Gualicho
boardgame.description:
Gualicho is a card game where you can combine very special powers!

The first to discard all of his cards wins... But it won't be that easy! Because raising new cards is going to be the slightest thing that can happen.

Some GUALICHOS ("spells") make the game difficult and others are hilariously uncomfortable garments that can accumulate.

But luckily there are powers that defend, heal and even divert the GUALICHOS so that they fall to another.

A game to laugh wildly while you can.

boardgame.name: Journey
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Journey is a solo roleplaying game for creatives, worldbuilders, and the Uncommonly Curious.

You hold in your hand a tool of imagination, a vehicle of creativity that has the capabilities to guide you deeper into the ephemeral locations and spaces of your own creation and help give them greater depth and form in both your mind and work.

Journey is a solo roleplaying game and an exercise in imagination and visualization, using game-style mechanics and concepts to guide you through the roads less traveled in worlds of your own creation.

It’s time to leave on a grand adventure.

Are you ready?

boardgame.name: Let's PLAAY Jai-Alai
boardgame.description:
Let's PLAAY Jai-Alai re-creates the experience of hanging out at a jai-alai fronton in Connecticut, Florida or Las Vegas in the 1970s and can be played in any one of multiple game modes. There's the solo betting mode, where it's just you and your wagering savvy matching wits with tonight's card. Or, get friends together and make a night of it, each making your own bets to see who's the top dog. Nobody available tonight? You can still make it a party, matching wits with one or more of our card stock fronton-fans, who will place their own bets as you place yours. Or, you can skip the betting entirely and create your own professional jai-alai tour with a regular season, playoffs and a league champion!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Technical Readout: 3050
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Battletech Technical Readout: 3050 provides illustrations, descriptions and game statistics for all state-of-the-art Inner Sphere Battlemechs and the Omnimechs used by the invading Clans.

User summary:

A revised version was published - Technical Readout: 3050 (Revised Edition)
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Battletech - Technical Readout:3050 The Return of Kerensky

boardgame.name: The Vagabond
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Homelessness is a common sight on the streets of Duskvol. The destitute and the damned roam the inbetween of every district save Whitecrown, finding refuge where and when they can before they are inevitably chased off by the Bluecoats or some other authority. Most citizens have learned to avoid the gaze of these dredges, but every so often there is a Vagabond who refuses to be ignored.

When you play a Vagabond, you earn xp when you address a challenge by getting by, finding a creative solution, or defying expectations. Lash out at the cruelty of fate, read faces, or indulge in the occasional moment of clarity. Find refuge in discard and seek a means out of the clockwork crush.

Are you a common fool or the herald of the end times? How does the heel of oppression weigh on the conscience of the forgotten? Can you ramble your way towards greater misfortunes?

boardgame.name: Chamuyo: A full!
boardgame.description: Chamuyo is a storytelling game in which you have to convince the judge by looking for your best arguments defending an association of letters. You are going to have to use your best chamuyo (chatter), so that the judge gives the points to you. If you don't win for best chamuyo, maybe you will earn points for rowing it!

boardgame.name: Chamuyo: De una!
boardgame.description: Chamuyo is a storytelling game in which you have to convince the judge by looking for your best arguments defending an association of letters. You are going to have to use your best chamuyo (chatter), so that the judge gives the points to you. If you don't win for best chamuyo, maybe you will earn points for rowing it!

boardgame.name: Creatures from Fairy-Tale and Myth (FotN)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold a host of iconic creatures from fairy-tales and myth, ready for your Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok game. These Denizens are built with a newly revised and streamlined version of the innovative Runic Games System - the complete new rules presented within these pages.

Each denizen is pre-built at 5 different levels of power, providing a Norn plenty of latitude of monster-type, from grunt to “boss-monster”, keeping the players guessing at every encounter. These innovative creatures are built with the new social combat mechanics, ensuring that each encounter is memorable and can resolve in more ways than simple violence.

Explore the town of Ris with an exciting adventure populated with all that crawls on the pages of this beautifully illustrated tome. Come and experience the danger and beauty that lies within the pages of Creatures from Fairy-Tale and Myth!

boardgame.name: Cape May: Vocations Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
As you begin your development of Cape May, choose your vocation from two randomly dealt cards. Activate this once-per-game benefit to maximize your wealth and build prestige as the most successful developer in Cape May!

This promo pack contains ten Vocation cards and one rule card.

It also contains a bonus Event card, titled;

P.01 Fifty-Eight Foot Elephant Tower Erected.
All players may take an additional action this round.

This twelve card pack was originally given away to pre-order customers from the publisher Thunderworks directly.

boardgame.name: Creatures from Fairy-Tale and Myth (Story Book)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Creatures from Fairy-Tale and Myth, an in-depth volume devoted to the most iconic creatures that transcend cultures and time. This book sets out to analyze each creature in terms of attributes, vulnerabilities, habits and summarizes the timeless stories that include them as the hero's adversary. You will also find a brand-new story involving these iconic creatures, sometimes told from the hero’s perspective, and sometimes recounted from the creature’s point of view. All of these entries are also beautifully rendered in brand new artwork that seeks to breathe new life into classic tales.

This lore book is RPG world and system agnostic, and presents memorable creatures that will captivate the audience. These beasts are not meant to be used for filler or random encounters. The creatures herein will aid the GM when creating "boss monsters" or adventures surrounding a certain type of legendary creature.

boardgame.name: All Over
boardgame.description:
User Summary

All Over is a RPG set in the kingdom of Abelon.

boardgame.name: The Quotidian
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Duskvol is a thriving metropolis with a burgeoning bureaucracy of wordsmiths, measurerulers, and beancounters powering its electroplasmic underbelly. You are one of the tens of thousands who go unnoticed; those who toil daily from tiny box to larger box to tiny box in service of a clockwork organization that groans under the collective choir of processes, paperwork, and team meetings. This is your life, your everyday - you Quotidian you.

When you play a Quotidian, you earn xp at the end of each session just because. You’ve ingratiated yourself to the system and will be rewarded meagerly. You’ve chosen to dabble in a life of crime, but there’s no denying it - your existence is comfortable, if sometimes bleak.

Who brought you into the fold with the others? What thrill from a life of crime can you not get from your day job? Did you think your life would end up this way?

boardgame.name: Time Force
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

TIME FORCE is a nonsensical hop, skip, and trip through time! The world is in peril and you brave heroes are tasked with traveling back in time to steer humanity away from the apocalypse.

Slip, crash, and stumble through the epic set pieces of history, meet notable figures, and fight for a better tomorrow!

Designed as a one-shot for 2-6 players, 2+ hours with a GM. Inspired by 90's Sci Fi like Stargate SG-1, Quantum Leap, and Star Trek.

Save the World! Change the Past! Time Force!

boardgame.name: D A O - Derivative Algorithmic Organism
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a DERIVATIVE ALGORITHMIC ORGANISM tasked with solving the universe's largest computation problem:


EXISTENCE!


You have been given a set of INPUTS called LIFE.

Your goal is to derive the OUPUT labelled MEANING.

To do so, you must fill out your BLACK BOX...
boardgame.rpg: D A O - Derivative Algorithmic Organism

boardgame.name: #INCITE: Resist or Obey
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

#INCITE is a micro-RPG that examines when demonstrations incite confrontation.

The game is designed as a zero-prep one shot tabletop RPG experience lasting around 1-2 hours. Character creation takes less than a minute and a robust meta-structure coupled with setting and encounter tables allows a Facilitator to begin crafting a narrative with virtually zero prep.

boardgame.name: Medusa and the Cursed Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Introducing Acantha, Lady of Sorrows, a new villain or patron for your campaign!

Medusa and the Cursed Forest is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters of 10th to 11th level, and is optimized for 5 characters with an average party level (APL) of 10. Characters of 10th level will find an encounter with the medusa exceedingly dangerous, but they do not have to fight her.

This adventure takes place in a petrified forest belonging to a powerful medusa. The forest can be placed in any campaign setting with uncharted wilderness. Additionally, the forest beasts could be swapped out for new creatures to fit a different biome, such as high in the mountains or near a desert.

Background
Once a faithful young acolyte to a goddess of war, Acantha tended to her god’s temple diligently and without protest. One fateful evening a rival god appeared and wrought destruction on the temple. Rather than take pity on Acantha, her goddess cursed her with the powers she is now feared for: her petrifying gaze and the mass of writhing snakes that protrude from her head. Little known, however, is that the curse also bound her life to the broken temple; if she strays from it for too long, she grows weak and begins to die.

In the millenia since she was cursed, her presence has imbued the surrounding forest with its own petrifying magic. Creatures that enter the depths of the forest risk being turned to stone by the latent magic and for each creature petrified, the forest grows further outward.

Now, Acantha is known as the Lady of Sorrows.

boardgame.name: Valor & Villainy: Antagonist's Arsenal
boardgame.description:
Some like to work together with their friends to fight against a terrible villain. Others like to be that villain and roast their friends into smoldering piles of ash. Whichever way you want to slice it, the Antagonist’s Arsenal has you covered, adding all the component’s you’ll need to play co-op against Mordak, or to take control of the 5 Villains from Lludwik’s Labyrinth and play them 1 vs Many!

This is an expansion which can be added to any Valor & Villainy game. It requires you own either Lludwik's Labyrinth or Minions of Mordak to use.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sewer Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 552nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features an open manhole on a remote road, providing an entrance to the sewers.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Prison Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 551st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small island serving as a prison for individual high value prisoners.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Descent of the Dead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 550th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a wide flight of stairs descending into the ground, probably to the entrance of an underground crypta.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: The Skipper
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Skipper- a psionic warrior with the power of teleportation! Using an ability called “skipping”, these "skippers" can teleport around foes to maneuver impossible battlefield strategies, dodge their enemies' attacks, and make powerful inertial attacks.

This class uses the first edition Pathfinder roleplaying game rules (found in the Core Rulebook) and Dreamscarred Press's psionics rule system (found in Ultimate Psionics).

boardgame.name: Psionics Cheatsheet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A crash course to Pathfinder's psionics rule system!

This supplement is for the first edition Pathfinder roleplaying game rules (found in the Core Rulebook) and Dreamscarred Press's psionics rule system (found in Ultimate Psionics).

boardgame.name: The Kambian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The kambian are a race of tall and skinny amphibious humanoids who can secrete a psionic poison through their skin. This psychotoxin causes all who come in contact with it to have horrific and dizzying visions of multiple possible futures. As curious about others as they are secretive about themselves, the kambian are a perfect race for someone who wants to play psionic character with any sort of touch or unarmed strike ability.

This class uses the first edition Pathfinder roleplaying game rules (found in the Core Rulebook) and Dreamscarred Press's psionics rule system (found in Ultimate Psionics).

boardgame.name: Levels 01-03
Levels 1-3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need to create a character "on the fly". Whether it's an NPC that your players are about to meet or to help you create scenarios, all you need is a spark of lightning to stimulate your imagination.

Books of the 100 5th SRD CHARACTERS series are companion volume to roleplaying games compatible with System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5). You will find in this book 100 characters ready to play. Information you'll find in this volume are designed for drag and drop: characters are completely described according to the rules of System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5).

boardgame.name: Necromancer's Sanctum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Necromancer’s Sanctum is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters of 13th to 14th level, and is optimized for 5 characters with an average party level (APL) of 13.

BACKGROUND
Seipris the Soulkeeper holds dominion over a subterranean empire of ghouls, vampires, and other undead. Deep beneath the surface in lightless tunnels and vast chambers, the civilized ghouls of the empire carved glory from flesh and stone under Seipris’ leadership. She led the empire to victory against the humanoids, and now that race is all but extinct in any territory the ghouls control.

The ghouls are content to reside in the lightless depths beneath the earth for now, but Seipris muses about what prizes exist under the sky. To this end, she tends to operate out of an enchanted sanctum capable of teleporting throughout the material plane in places where the underworld meets the surface.

Seipris’ activities near the surface have earned her a fearsome reputation, drawing the attention of adventurers throughout the realm.

Publisher's blurb:

Information you'll find in this volume are designed for drag and drop: characters are completely described according to the rules of System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5).

boardgame.name: Levels 16-20 Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you need to create a character "on the fly". Whether it's an NPC that your players are about to meet or to help you create scenarios, all you need is a spark of lightning to stimulate your imagination.

Books of the 100 5th SRD CHARACTERS series are companion volume to roleplaying games compatible with System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5). You will find in this book 100 characters ready to play. Information you'll find in this volume are designed for drag and drop: characters are completely described according to the rules of System Reference Document 5.1 (SRD5).

boardgame.name: Danger in the Dead Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travel inside the head of an undead paladin to save her from herself!

Danger in the Dead Knight is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters of 5th to 6th level and is optimized for five characters with an average party level (APL) of 5.

This adventure takes place in a small town that could be transplanted to any fantasy setting. The characters must help an undead paladin deal with their broken oaths. They team up with a cleric that can cast astral projection to go on a journey through the paladin's memories, helping it confront its failures.

BACKGROUND
Decades ago, the village of Honeywatch was no more than a patch of grass near the thinnest point of a river for miles. Two armies collided here, vying for control of the crossing. One side was led by a young paladin named Lillian Highspark, and the opposition was led by an elven cleric named Mela Stonedane. It was Lillian’s first time leading a larger force and she maneuvered them poorly, resulting in a massacre. She managed to survive but, overwhelmed with grief, she forsook her oaths and abandoned her post. She died without reconciling her actions and rose as an undead, the force of her guilt dragging her beyond the grave.

In recent years, Lillian has been seen and encountered around Honeywatch reliving her failures. She is often accompanied by Mela, who learned of Lillian’s state and returned to Honeywatch to keep Lillian from accidentally hurting more people.

boardgame.name: Bandits at the Estate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bandits at the Estate is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters of 5th level, and is optimized for 5 characters with an average party level (APL) of 5.

Clear out the bandits in the estate, and the estate is free for the taking.

BACKGROUND
The Barnwell Estate was once home to an adventuring party. The party was led by a wizard named Marcellinus Barnwell. The others’ names have been lost to time.

Eventually, the adventurer’s passed away or moved on, leaving behind Hannchen, the estate’s keeper. Hannchen has watched over the estate for decades. Recently, she was forced out of the estate by a band of mercenaries that call themselves The Cobalt Phantom Company.

The Cobalt Phantom Company is a disreputable mercenary band that operates in the region near the Barnwell Estate. They are headed by a vindictive ghost known as Cobalt.

boardgame.name: Vaskil Valley: Wrath of the Wyvern Kings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vaskil Valley: Wrath of the Wyvern Kings is a Fifth Edition adventure optimized for four to six characters. This book describes the monsters and villains who the heroes of the story—the player characters—must challenge to bring the adventure to its conclusion.

The book presents Vaskil Valley, a region in DMDave’s Omeria campaign setting, as a full “sandbox” within which you can host a bevy of adventures and campaigns. The fundamental details of the setting are included in this book. However, we’ve left plenty of room for you to create your own adventures, campaigns, villains, and epic battles.

Adventure Summary
A riveting mix of western and fantasy tropes, Vaskil Valley: Wrath of the Wyvern Kings sees a group of characters—native to the region or not—handle the threat of the newcomer Wyvern Kings and their detrimental presence.

The book’s main plot deals with the Wyvern Kings themselves. During the first chapter, the characters learn of the Wyvern Kings and how they’ve affected Vaskil Valley and its people. As the adventure progresses, accumulated evidence leads to the true identity of the Wyvern Kings and how the characters can stop their constant attacks.

While working on the mystery of the Wyvern Kings, the characters also have the opportunity to complete additional side quests. Most of these side quests see the characters handle the side effects of the Wyvern Kings’ presence in Vaskil Valley. They also offer the characters a chance to further build their experience and arsenal of magic items in preparation for their final confrontation with the Wyvern Kings (and the real threat of this adventure).

boardgame.name: The Catlands Jazzband Gazetter
boardgame.description:
"A micro-setting within the Dreaming Autumnal Wilds. The cats here, inbetwixt their nine lives, felt lonely. They stole jazz, in concept; and it has begun doing strange things to the mortal souls they've drawn in. It is a preview, in a sense, to a much larger setting of nostalgic hooks and wayward wanderers; inspired by the likes of Big Fish, Over the Garden Wall, Nightmare Before Christmas, O, Brother Where Art Thou, and other misremembered tales of yore and youth spent in rural living."

https://goatmansgoblet.itch.io/

boardgame.name: Recared's Unclean Pamphlet
boardgame.description:
From the pamphlet:

[A] collection of new unclean powers for your campaign. [...] These powers may be introduced to the campaign as scrolls, either found in a dungeon or --for a really fun time-- used by NPC opponents who use the powers to make the PCs suffer.

boardgame.name: 6: Siege – The Board Game
boardgame.description:
First rule of hunting, become your target, then hunt yourself down.

You are agents from Team Six. You come from secret services and taskforces from all around the globe, and train together either as attackers or defenders. Plan the assault! Ready the defense! Coordinate your Operators! Outwit the opposing team! …before they make their next move.

6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

To win a game of 6: Siege – The Board Game, you must fulfill the mission’s objective for your side or eliminate the opposing team. During each round of the game, each player has two activation phases in which they can activate two to three operators. When activating an operator, a player has a wide range of actions to choose from: mandatory movement, shooting at targets, over-watching to cover specific areas, or making use of the team’s or their personal gadgets! All this while time is ticking down… Operators can also lean to protect themselves while crouched, opening their line of sight without losing the benefit of cover. Every map of the game also has an upper floor that Operators can utilize when they want to navigate the map more quickly. The game rules are intuitive with how cinematic it is, and the flow of gameplay is bolstered as a result. Of course, we couldn’t leave out a destructible environment! While the defenders often barricade the map, the attackers tend to break walls using grenades and hammers. The real-time flow of the game may be interrupted when a player calls for line of sight. If you think it is wrong, you could inflict a time penalty on your opponent… but also risk giving them the edge if you’re proven wrong! Which group of Operators will accomplish their strategy and be victorious? It’s up to you!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

listing.notes: Fresh Recruit Pledge preorder.

*** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Exclusive Edition 'Trooper' Pledge for 6: Siege Board Game by Mythic Games. Includes 1 core game, all expansions (Year 1 - Re Enforce, Year 2 - High Impact, Year 3 - Hard Breach, Year 4 Dark Horizon, Year 5 Shadow Tactics), Map Pack 1 - Concrete City, Map Pack 2 - Dead End, Exclusive alternate Zero operator, and all daily unlocks. Order this Board Game now and Get FREE SHIPPING in the Continental US! Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve
boardgame.description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve, in Belgium.

boardgame.name: Spire's End: Hildegard
boardgame.description:
Hildegard is a stand-alone card game adventure set in the world of Spire’s End. Over the years, I've grown fond of Hildegard -- a main character from the first game. This is her story.


After the dark descent into the Spire, I felt like a change of pace was in order. With Hildegard, I can do that. I've left behind the cold and the dark for something warm and vibrant.


The game has almost no set-up, intuitive rules, and minimal components. No DM, bookkeeping, or character sheets. What you will have is a stack of over 400 beautifully designed and illustrated cards with some custom dice!


Like the previous game in the Spire's End series, the story unfolds one card at a time. You will be presented with numerous-narrative driven choices, enemies, and items that move the story along.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Spire's End: Hildegard – Bows and Breakfast

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the edge of civilization, where brigands rule and where the shadows are long. In tiny villages, people huddle in fear as terrors prowl the night. Out here, your word is as good as your sword and nobody will miss you.

Five Leagues From the Borderlands is a set of solo miniatures rules for fantasy campaign games. Taking inspiration from gritty "medieval-fantasy" like The Black Company and Harn, this is a world of brutal combat and ever-present danger.

The new version has been polished and improved, tidying up the rules, getting rid of excessive dice rolling and improving the pacing of the campaign game. In addition we’ve added:

Difficulty settings for players who want more or less challenge.
An Unusual background table for your characters.
Monsters from ogres to dragons. And a random monster generator.
Village events.
Encounters are far more varied: Enemy strengths and flaws, leadership figures, unusual battle conditions (from fighting in the rain to haunted terrain) and each type of Threat now has its own unique encounter table.
Many enemies also have special rules now, to make them more unique.
Multiple options for tailoring a long term campaign, such as “new game plus” options and large-scale campaign events such as holy crusades, rat-men invasions or the literal end of days!
New items to find, including magical weapons, potions and scrolls.
And much MUCH more.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Caverns & Pits: Five Leagues From the Borderlands
The Distant Marches: A Five Leagues From the Borderlands Expansion pack
Every Journey Begins on a Road: A Five Leagues From the Borderlands Expansion pack
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 3rd Edition
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Micro Pack 3: The Broadhill Ogre – A New Encounter for Five Leagues from the Borderlands Second Edition
Scenario 1: The Sunken Temple – For Use With Five Leagues from the Borderlands Second Edition
Tools of War: An expansion pack for Five Leagues from the Borderlands (Second Edition)

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Arlon
boardgame.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Arlon, in Belgium.

Administrative town where all the ministries are represented, military town housing an infantry school, educational center which welcomes many students from neighboring countries, cultural, commercial and industrial center, Arlon has also become a sought-after accommodation center.
With a certain charm, the pretty city combines traditions, folklore and leisure activities in a quality environment. Think of the essential Maitrank festivals

– partial translated description from back of box

boardgame.name: The Eclipse System Starmap
boardgame.description:
This season, a whole new way to play LIGHT is being brought to your table! Building on the Strike rules from last season, Eclipse will feature new rules to help you run a campaign for LIGHT. What better way to do that than with a map of the solar system?

With the rules from the first module, you'll get the foundation on how to use the map to run your own high stakes campaign in the LIGHT universe!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Control
boardgame.description:
Control is the first module, and it brings a map of the system and rules for coordinating missions and campaigns across humanity's final holdings in Sol. Get your squad together, Beacons, and take to the stars!

Source: The Devlog.

boardgame.name: Age of Musket: Shako and Musket 1854-1856 – Rules for scaled battles of the Crimean War
boardgame.description:
These rules are part of a series that cover the era of the Musket (1690's - mid 19th century).
The rules of Shako and Musket 1854-1856 are designed to capture the flavour of this specific war with the subtle changes and nuances.
They are designer to be easy to use, fast flowing and capable of covering small and large games.

Sequence of play:
1- Declare Charges
2- Charge response check
3- Charge reaction movements
4- Melee resolution
5- Breakthrough check (for charging units)
6- Breakthrough follow-up (resolve new melees)
7- Breakthrough results per 6
8- Other movement
9- Other fire
10- Morale check
11- Morale reaction (retire, retreat, rout, follow-up)

Miniatures: 2mm to 25mm
Players will need a tape measure, D6, pen and paper

– extract from rulebook

boardgame.name: Cupid: Tricks & Tactics
boardgame.description:
Cupid is a trick taking card game for 2 players that uses part of a 52 card deck. Trick values are determined by the cards played: cards might be added together, subtracted, or simply worth one point. It all depends on which cards are in the trick. Both high and low cards are useful for offense and defense, and there is no such thing as a safe lead in this game... unless you pay attention to what has been played carefully.

Based loosely on the Roman god of desire's tale, Cupid is won by the player who can manage their cards, track what has been played, and cede control of the lead when needed.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ink Transference
boardgame.description:
Ink Transference is a play by mail game where players get to be mildly psychic aliens learning about humans through lab reports.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Bloodline
boardgame.description:
A chess-like game wherein armies of magical creatures battle to control the kingdom. Each player gets a king, queen, prince, princess, 8 peasants, and two each of dragons, knights, priests, guards, assassins, and witches. The board features secret passageways and obstacles, and bonuses for both the strongest and weakest player.

Goal: to kill off opponents' royal family, or, if players only have three pieces left, to have the higher score (determined by the value of the pieces one has captured).

boardgame.name: Interstellar Errands
boardgame.description:
INTERSTELLAR ERRANDS is a DM-less RPG for 1-5 players who want to have a quick space-bound adventure over breakfast, lunch, or an evening snack. Invent a character, find a planet for them to travel to, and roll dice to find that mystical device for your tiny alien mentor!

The entire RPG fits onto a single-sided page, so you can just print and post it to your fridge door for convenient snacktime play. All you need is a d6, a d20 (optional), and your imagination!

Made for the FRIDGE RPG JAM hosted by ludipe.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: It's Dangerous To Go Alone - Take This
boardgame.description:
It's Dangerous To Go Alone — Take This is a spur of the moment RPG where one person (GM) goes through the contents of their bag and gives them one thing from their bag to a player to take with them on an adventure into the unknown? The GM plays as a towns-person who "wakes" the player(s) having found them washed up along the shore of their town. Upon discovering the player(s) have no memory of how they came to be there the towns-person takes them home. Along the way the player discovers there is trouble afoot in the realm they have found themselves in. Unable to not answer the call for help they volunteer to help, however they don't have any equipment of their own. But they're in luck the towns-person has a (...) and is more than happy to lend it to the player in exchange for their assistance. And off the player goes on their adventure.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: It's Dangerous To Go Alone: Take This

boardgame.name: The Dare Luck Club
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Grab a hold of those handlebars –you’re about to launch into a nostalgia-fueled thrill ride that’s 3-parts fantastic adventure and 1-part time machine! The Dare-Luck Club Rule Book gives you every thing you need to play through multifarious adolescent-adventures as a misfit gang of kids living in a deceptively quaint hometown. -But under its surface, this whistle-stop is crawling with dangers no adult would ever believe: haunted houses, lost treasures, mob-activity, alien invasions, occult sorcery, and the effects of weird science, just to name a few!

This role-playing game comes jam-packed with over 200-pages of information,–from designing your Dare-Lucker to the citizens and creatures they might face to advice on generating and running these escapades. This book also contains a full-length starting adventure, “Mixing It up with the Mob.” …while sneaking an overdue book back into the library, the club learns about a mafia heist only they can stop!

Don’t just stand there! Shave years off your age –bring this book back to your gaming group and enjoy the wild exploits of a youth ill-spent! You look just eccentric enough to be part of the club… The Dare-Luck Club!

boardgame.name: Anastasia Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
Travel around the board, and try to find the Locket, the Royal Crown and the Music box discs to put on your passport. Avoid the evil forces of Rasputin and the Minions, or they’ll take one of your discs!

Be the first to get all three discs and move HOME, and you will prove that Anya is really Anastasia, Princess of Imperial Russia!

boardgame.name: Paradise-Opoly
boardgame.description:
Paradise-Opoly is a nostalgic and detailed memoir of the small mountain town of Paradise, CA that was devastated by wildfire in 2018. The games base mode uses classic monopoly mechanics and is completely redesigned and re-themed around Paradise culture, history and community. The process of whittling down what would be represented from the town involved hundreds of community members suggesting and voting online what should be included. The result is a rich and well-rounded portrayal of our little town. My main purpose in the design of the game was for it to really give someone that feeling of home when they play it, whether you are from there or not. Nearly every person who was in Paradise that day lost everything. Not only their homes, pets and even family members, but they lost their community. The town was completely changed forever in a matter of hours. My intent is to capture the spirit of Paradise that so many love, cherish and miss dearly.

I am not a game developer, by any means. I just had an idea, shortly after the fire, to create this game to commemorate the town. Since that idea I have learned many things and the idea has grown into a beautifully designed and well thought out game. I am currently in the middle of a Kickstarter campaign and fully expect to reach my funding goal so I can produce 3000 games. 100% of the net-profits from my company sales of the games and merchandise will be donated back to non-profits aimed at immediate rebuilding projects for lower income residents of Paradise. I intend to represent my town and help in any way I can.

The game features fun, vibrant and colorful artwork and design by Traci Van Wagoner and Kurt Keller of Imagine That! Design in New York. They have done an amazing job with conveying the detail and nuance I wanted in every illustration and design. All of the metal game miniatures are custom designed by the very talented 3D sculptor, Chad Hoverter, and represent somethng special and unique to Paradise. Even the old "houses and hotels" are now Miner's Tents and Log Cabins, one of the many references to the very prominent gold rush history of the area. All of the "Property" cards contain a short story or description about the landmark or place they contain. Included is a full color information booklet with extended versions of the stories. For some playing that weren't locals or for kids who may not know all the history of their town the game serves as a fun learning experience of the towns culture and beginnings.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Koboldly Go!
boardgame.description:
Calling all Kobolds!

Gather your crew, assemble your ship, and take to the depths of space on a mission to discover strange new worlds. To seek out life and new civilizations.

To Koboldly Go where no lizard has gone before!

This game requires a game runner to create challenges and stories and adjudicate rules interactions.

Required hardware: Standard deck of playing cards, tokens, writing implements. Tape is helpful but not required.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: My Welcomed Guest
boardgame.description:
My Welcomed Guest is a solo game about being trapped in Faerie and trying to bargain your way home. Throughout the game you will be answering questions and potentially accruing Taboo, which is an indicator of faerie taboos you may have breached. Sometimes without you knowing what action it was that directly broke the taboo. The game will be played over five acts.

This game was created as part of the Short and Easy game Jam.

You will need some additional materials:

Something to write on.
You can print out the game and write directly on the paper, use a journal, an electronic source, or something else that suits your fancy.

Something to write with.
If you have a favorite pen or pencil, get that. If not, anything will do, a pen, pencil or crayon.

A six sided die.
There are many electronic versions available if you don’t have a d6 easily accessible.

A place to accrue Taboo marks.
This can the corner or back side of a page, an index card, a sticky note, or a bowl to hold glass beads. The important thing is to know how many Taboo marks you have accrued.



Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Absolute Emperor: Napoleonic Wargame Battles
boardgame.description:
From the late Revolutionary Wars and Egyptian campaign, to the battles of Austerlitz, Borodino, Leipzig, and Waterloo, Absolute Emperor is a mass battle wargame that provides all the rules needed to play during this period of grand armies and sweeping campaigns.

Players' armies are composed of multiple corps, with command and control being of the utmost importance, all influenced by the elan of your general.

Do you follow in the footsteps of Napoleon and be crowned the Absolute Emperor or stand against tyranny as Wellington and Blücher.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Absolute Emperor

boardgame.name: Dancing Queen
boardgame.description:
Dancing Queen is a 2-player, 9-card game about bringing friends to a dance party. You and your opponent both have in mind a particular dance to perform. Will you get your way? How many boys and girls should you bring? Will you bring a girl secretly dressed up as a boy to foil your opponent's plans?

Both players start with a secret goal, and need to manipulate the gender mix in play to fulfil their goals. There are opportunities to swap your secret goal and to change the gender of a dancer. When a round ends, you reveal your goals to compare who has done better. There are instant-win conditions on some cards. If you manage to achieve these feats, you win a round immediately.

This short and tricky card game features bluffing, setting traps, pushing your luck and reading your opponent.

—description from the designer

2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best Overall Game
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best 2-player Game
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best New Designer
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best Rule Book

boardgame.name: You Decide: The Financial Education Game
boardgame.description:
Your family has come together to plan their finances. You already know your current situation and what your financial goal is, but… How will you reach that goal? What will your strategy be?

In “You Decide” (Tú Decides) the players adopt the role of a family that seeks to fulfill its great financial goal, while worrying about the income, expenses, debts and contingencies of each month. Each family has an economic situation that must improve, for this they make financial planning decisions and each month they can choose which aspect of their family finances they give special care to. The family first to achieve its great financial goal wins the game.

This game was developed for the financial education department of the Solidarity and Social Investment Fund (FOSIS) of the Ministry of Social Development of the Government of Chile, to be used in training for heads of household in all regions of the country.
More than 4000 units have been distributed and it is in its third edition. Apart from head of household training, It has been distributed and applied to schools throughout Chile and has been successfully received by teachers and students. National tournaments have also been held.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Save Now
boardgame.description:
Save now (original title "Ahorra es Cuando")

You are part of a group of friends. You all have different interests, but, in turn, you have something in common: you want to have fun, do activities and buy the things you want. To achieve your goals, you must earn money, save, and learn about yout rights. But be careful! You could find advertising or tempting offers that make you spend impulsively, going out of budget or buying things that you do not really need or that do not meet your expectations.

In Save Now you will assume the role of a young man or woman, seeking to achieve your savings goals. In each round of the game you must plan your activities and manage your budget, making decisions that allow you to earn money and save or spend it. Doing the things you love and meeting your savings goals will earn you victory points to win the game.

Save Now is a Financial Education game developed for the National Costumers Service of Chile (SERNAC), aimed at high school youth from all over Chile with the aim of encouraging savings and responsible consumption practices.

Through this material, young players will apply concepts such as planning and budgeting, managing their income based on one or more savings goals. In this way, the game allows to consolidate financial knowledge acquired in various training instances and to understand saving as a fundamental habit in the development of healthy consumption behaviors in the face of current market conditions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Learn with Eddu
boardgame.description:
What can I spend my money on? How should I invest to increase my income? How much can I spend from my salary? How can I manage my money in the best way?

When it comes time to manage the money that you have every month, many questions arise. But here is Eddu with his advice to give you a little help to take care of your money now and in the future.

Learn with Eddu is a board game whose objective is to give basic notions of the administration of personal finances to young people of school age, as well as to initiate conversations that clarify the doubts on these subjects.

Eddu's game is an initiative of “Falabella Financiero”, and is part of its Financial Education Program that develops various activities, including educational interventions for young people between 12 and 15 years old whose objective is to improve the basic skills of the notion and administration of the money.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Chaos Chosen Team Card Pack
boardgame.description:
Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Chaos Chosen teams.


5 Player Reference cards for Beastman Runner Linemen, Chosen Blockers, Chaos Trolls, Chaos Ogres and Minotaurs
2 Star Player cards for Morg 'n' Thorg and Lord Borak the Despoiler
8 Random Event Special Play cards
8 Miscellaneous Mayhem Special Play cards
20 Blank Player cards: 13x Beastman Runner Lineman, 4x Chosen Blocker, 1x Chaos Troll, 1x Chaos Ogre, and 1x Minotaur
The all-important card explaining how to use the other cards, with a red card on the reverse


–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Chaos Chosen Team Card Pack

boardgame.name: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon – Gang Bangers Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is the first expansion for Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon. Players can now be in charge of one of five gangs, like the aggressive and straightforward Merkin, or the more controlling and in-depth Kthulhu Kids. They have to meet their Gang's requirements by buying certain card types or inflicting damage on their opponents, and then, players can recruit Gangsters from their hideout to bolster their builds. Also, the expansion replaces the original 12 Legends from Annihilageddon with 30 new Legendary Treasure cards.

—description from the publihser
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon Deck-Building Game

boardgame.name: Das Weinstraßen Spiel
boardgame.description:
This promotional game for the German Weinstrasse region is structured like Monopoly, but without the game element of investing in houses and hotels. Increases in value result from 6 share cards per business colour, each of which can be bought at a fixed price. Some of the event cards (profits and losses are possible) are directly related to all business colours.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ancient Knowledge
boardgame.description:
Ancient Knowledge is a strategic card game for 2 to 4 players. Build fabulous monuments for the glory of your civilization and make sure you use your knowledge to keep it alive through the ages and make history. Find the best synergy to spread knowledge before your monuments decline. From the Mexican pyramids to the Sphinx of Giza and the famous cities of Tiahuanaco or Sumer, counteract the effects of time by seeking innovations and build your prestige. Only the most prestigious Builder will win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Obolus
boardgame.description:
The players roll the number- and color-die and set a game token on the corresponding space of the game board. If the space is already occupied the player pays a coin into the cash bowl.

The game ends when a player sets a token onto the last free space of any color. This player wins the game and the contents of the cash bowl.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tacmento
Taĉmento
boardgame.description:
The Spanish tercios became the military elite of Renaissance Europe. In the tactical field, the basic formation was the squadron.

In Taĉmento you must lead your troops in the middle of a battle and will have to follow the Commanding Officer’s orders to reorganize the formation promptly to ensure victory; otherwise, the battle will be lost.

You must arrange the cards so that all Military Orders (objectives) are currently completed in the grid layout (Formation) within 12 turns. The game ends as soon as this win condition is present, you do not need to play all 12 turns.

Will your tactical movements be fast and precise enough to succeed?

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Schwäbisch Hall
boardgame.description: The famous Monopoly now themed around Schwäbisch Hall in southwest Germany. Monopoly game play, only the theme - like all themed Monopoly versions - resembles the city.

boardgame.name: The Long Way Home
boardgame.description:
The Long Way Home is an historical Print & Play solitaire board game based on the true story non-fiction book with the same title. The player must fly their Pan American Clipper the long way home from New Zealand on a westward route due to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7, 1941. Along the way, the player will face fuel problems and other difficulties on their journey home due to being out of the Pan American support network for more than half of the trip.

Game components include navigation mats, calendar mat, a tables book, and a counter sheet with various counters to location and status of the Clipper along it's route.

The player moves his Clipper aircraft game counter across the various navigation mats during his journey.

The ultimate goal of the game is to safely fly the Clipper back to the United States before February 1, 1942. Will you succeed?

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sockenmonster
Носочные монстры
boardgame.description:
This version of Sock Monsters does not have the legacy component, just a mini-expansion with three additional pieces.

While the house is empty, brave and industrious elves set out to tidy up. But the sock monsters are always lurking in the dark! Search chests and lockers, find socks and be the first to collect three pairs. Monsters are eager to steal lone socks. Watch out or, better yet, unleash them on your opponents.

Your game character is a brave and industrious elf trying to rescue socks from sock monsters. You start at the center of the game board, while monsters move from the corners in. Players make moves as monsters first. The monsters lurk around the house, always eager to steal a lone sock from a careless elf and carry it into a dark corner.

The next player to make a move takes a color die and puts it underneath his or her monster figure. When making a move, the players lift the figures slightly above the board, so the die underneath moves with the figure but is not visible from the outside. After making the move, the monster figure can be lifted to see the die. If the top face is showing a closed eye picture, this means the monster has fallen asleep and the player’s turn is over. If the die is showing an open eye picture, the player can perform an action.

After finishing the monster turn, the players then take a turn as elves, trying to find colored socks in chests and cabinets on the game board. If a matching pair of socks is collected, elves put them on their hands, feet and ears – and that’s really hard work!

The game ends when any one player has collected three pairs of socks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: NEUE HELDEN ... braucht das Land
boardgame.description:
In NEUE HELDEN ... braucht das Land you are a new uprising hero in your city. But there are a lot of other heros who all want to become the number one. Your goal is to become the greatest superhero in your city. For that you have to participate in hero missions. For every mission you have successfully finished, you get hero points. The person you first reaches 50,000 fans wins and is therefore the greatest hero in the city.

—description from the publisher

Neue Helden: Die Spielwelt

Aller Anfang ist schwer, wenn dich nicht gerade eine mutierte Spinne beißt oder du von einem anderen Planeten kommst. Als auf­streben­der Superheld musst du erst mal zeigen, was du drauf­hast, wenn du der Star deiner Stadt werden willst! Und nie vergessen: Dein Erzfeind Dr. Übel könnte hinter jeder Ecke lauern!

Neue Helden: Die Spielidee

Du wählst eine Mission für deinen Helden – und startest mit ihm direkt ins Abenteuer! Mit dem Würfel und deinen besonderen Fertig­keiten kämpfst du dich durch Aufträge und gewinnst neue Fans! Als Belohnung für gemeisterte Auf­gaben winken abge­fahrene Ausrüst­ungen wie das Taschen­gehirn und die Raketen­stiefel! Aber nimm dich in Acht: Triffst du unterwegs auf andere Spieler, kommt es zum Kräfte­messen! Welcher Held kann am meisten Fans begeistern und wird zum Star der Stadt?

—description from the publisher (German)
